text: Georgy Petrovich Fedotov (Гео́ргий Петро́вич Федо́тов, October 1 (13) 1886, Saratov, Russian Empire, – September 1, 1951, New York, US) was a Russian religious philosopher, historian, essayist, author of many books on Orthodox culture, regarded by some as a founder of Russian "theological culturology". Fedotov left the Soviet Russia for France in 1925, then in 1939 emigrated to the United States where he taught at St. Vladimir Orthodox Seminary, New York, and continued publishing books up until his death in 1951. He was a Guggenheim Fellow for the academic year 1946–1947. ==Works== *A Treasury of Russian Spirituality, [comp.& ed.], London, Sheed & Ward, 1950 == References== ==External links== *Biography in English at Academia.edu Category:1886 births Category:1951 deaths Category:People from Saratov Category:Russian male essayists Category:Russian philosophers Category:20th-century essayists Category:20th-century philosophers
